document_data.name: Glaive
document_data.mainbody: '''Glaives''' were a type of reach weapon in the [[pole arm]] family.
document_data.Description: Glaives were pole arms that, in their basic form, were long wooden poles mounted with a sword-like cutting blade.
document_data.Weaponology: Glaives were two-handed melee weapons with a {{SI|10|ft|long=yes}} reach. Because it was a pole arm, it couldn't be used to attack adjacent foes. They were most effective in large numbers in a phalanx, or when they could be set against a charging opponent. Even though the tip of the blade was sharp and the back spike could be swung to penetrate armor, the glaive was considered a slashing weapon.
document_data.Availability: * In many of the bazaars found across [[Zakhara]], one could find a glaive for around 5 to 9 [[gold piece]]s depending upon how good they were at haggling.<ref>
document_data.History: Glaives first became available in the [[Netheril|Netheril Empire]] in {{YearlinkConvert|2171|NY}}.
document_data.Varieties:
* [[Naginata]], as well as its shortened version the nagimaki, were glaives unique to the land of [[Kara-Tur]]. They were typically used by footmen and horsemen respectively.
* '''Saw-toothed glaives''' were variety of glaives with a ''+3 [[item enchantment|enchantment]]'' that were commonly used by creatures on the [[Lower Planes]], primarily [[bearded devil]]s. They had a treble-hook arranged at their base that curved backwards, allowing the wielder to entangle or snag their foes.
document_data.Notable glaives:
* The [[demon lord]] [[Baphomet]] carried a glaive referred to as "Heart-cleaver."
* The [[tiefling]] [[warrior]] [[Havilar]] carried a glaive she referred to as "Devil Slayer".{{Cite digital book/Brimstone Angels/Kindle|658}}

Usage.Individuals:
* [[Dauphal]] was known to carry a ''+1 flaming glaive''.
* [[Syr'daun Hunzrin]] was renowned for his skill with glaives.
Usage.Races & Sentient Creatures:
* [[Blackguard]]s often favored the glaive over other weapons.
* The leaders of [[gnoll]] packs were often known to fight with glaives.
* [[Justice archon]]s were occasionally known to fight with glaives.
* Whenever a [[molydeus]] was a servant of baphomet, they always fought with a demonic glaive gifted to them by the demon lord himself.
* [[Oni mage]]s were often known to fight with glaives.
* [[Sorrowsworn]]s of the demonic variety were often known to favor fighting with ''+2 glaives''.
